paragraphs.content: Chapter 15
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 15

paragraphs.content: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

paragraphs.content: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

paragraphs.content: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

paragraphs.content: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

paragraphs.content: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

paragraphs.content: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

paragraphs.content: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

paragraphs.content: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

paragraphs.content: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

paragraphs.content: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

paragraphs.content: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?

paragraphs.content: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

paragraphs.content: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?

paragraphs.content: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

paragraphs.content: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

paragraphs.content: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

paragraphs.content: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

paragraphs.content: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

paragraphs.content: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

paragraphs.content: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

paragraphs.content: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.

paragraphs.content: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

paragraphs.content: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

paragraphs.content: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

paragraphs.content: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

paragraphs.content: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:
paragraphs.contentHtml: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

paragraphs.content: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.

paragraphs.content: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

paragraphs.content: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

paragraphs.content: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

paragraphs.content: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

paragraphs.content: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

paragraphs.content: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

paragraphs.content: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

paragraphs.content: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
